trans-unit.source: Score Matchbox Recommender
trans-unit.target: Score Matchbox Recommender

trans-unit.source: Scores predictions for a dataset using the Matchbox recommender
trans-unit.target: Scores predictions for a dataset using the Matchbox recommender

trans-unit.source: Category: <legacyLink xlink:href="BE8A69B7-D1E3-4FA2-A174-7ABE0BCCE4E9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Machine Learning / Score</legacyLink>
trans-unit.target: Category: <legacyLink xlink:href="BE8A69B7-D1E3-4FA2-A174-7ABE0BCCE4E9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Machine Learning / Score</legacyLink>

trans-unit.source: Module Overview
trans-unit.target: Module Overview

trans-unit.source: You can use the <ui>Score Matchbox Recommender</ui> module to make predictions from a trained Matchbox recommender.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <ui>Score Matchbox Recommender</ui> module to make predictions from a trained Matchbox recommender.

trans-unit.source: This module supports four different kinds of predictions:
trans-unit.target: This module supports four different kinds of predictions:

trans-unit.source: Predict ratings for a given user and item
trans-unit.target: Predict ratings for a given user and item

trans-unit.source: Recommend items to a given user
trans-unit.target: Recommend items to a given user

trans-unit.source: Find users related to a given user
trans-unit.target: Find users related to a given user

trans-unit.source: Find items related to a given item
trans-unit.target: Find items related to a given item

trans-unit.source: The latter three kinds of predictions can operate in two modes:
trans-unit.target: The latter three kinds of predictions can operate in two modes:

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Production mode</legacyBold>: Considers all users or items (typically used in a web service).
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Production mode</legacyBold>: Considers all users or items (typically used in a web service).

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Evaluation mode</legacyBold>: Operates on the reduced set of users or items that can be evaluated (typically used during experimentation).
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Evaluation mode</legacyBold>: Operates on the reduced set of users or items that can be evaluated (typically used during experimentation).

trans-unit.source: Note that you can also create scores for new users.
trans-unit.target: Note that you can also create scores for new users.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_NewUsers" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">this section</legacyLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_NewUsers" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">this section</legacyLink>.

trans-unit.source: About the Matchbox Recommender
trans-unit.target: About the Matchbox Recommender

trans-unit.source: The main aim of a recommendation system is to recommend one or more "items" to "users" of the system.
trans-unit.target: The main aim of a recommendation system is to recommend one or more "items" to "users" of the system.

trans-unit.source: Examples of an item could be a movie, restaurant, book, or song.
trans-unit.target: Examples of an item could be a movie, restaurant, book, or song.

trans-unit.source: A user could be a person, group of persons, or other entity with item preferences.
trans-unit.target: A user could be a person, group of persons, or other entity with item preferences.

trans-unit.source: There are two principal approaches to recommender systems.
trans-unit.target: There are two principal approaches to recommender systems.

trans-unit.source: The first is the <legacyBold>content-based</legacyBold> approach, which makes use of features for both users and items.
trans-unit.target: The first is the <legacyBold>content-based</legacyBold> approach, which makes use of features for both users and items.

trans-unit.source: Users may be described by properties such as age and gender, and items may be described by properties such as author and manufacturer.
trans-unit.target: Users may be described by properties such as age and gender, and items may be described by properties such as author and manufacturer.

trans-unit.source: Typical examples of content-based recommendation systems can be found on social matchmaking sites.
trans-unit.target: Typical examples of content-based recommendation systems can be found on social matchmaking sites.

trans-unit.source: The second approach is <legacyBold>collaborative filtering</legacyBold>, which uses only identifiers of the users and the items and obtains implicit information about these entities from a (sparse) matrix of ratings given by the users to the items.
trans-unit.target: The second approach is <legacyBold>collaborative filtering</legacyBold>, which uses only identifiers of the users and the items and obtains implicit information about these entities from a (sparse) matrix of ratings given by the users to the items.

trans-unit.source: We can learn about a user from the items they have rated and from other users who have rated the same items.
trans-unit.target: We can learn about a user from the items they have rated and from other users who have rated the same items.

trans-unit.source: The Matchbox recommender combines collaborative filtering with a content-based approach.
trans-unit.target: The Matchbox recommender combines collaborative filtering with a content-based approach.

trans-unit.source: It is therefore considered a <legacyBold>hybrid recommender</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: It is therefore considered a <legacyBold>hybrid recommender</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: When a user is relatively new to the system, predictions are improved by making use of the feature information about the user, thus addressing the well-known "cold-start" problem.
trans-unit.target: When a user is relatively new to the system, predictions are improved by making use of the feature information about the user, thus addressing the well-known "cold-start" problem.

trans-unit.source: However, once there are a sufficient number of ratings from a particular user, it is possible to make fully personalized predictions for them based on their specific ratings rather than on their features alone.
trans-unit.target: However, once there are a sufficient number of ratings from a particular user, it is possible to make fully personalized predictions for them based on their specific ratings rather than on their features alone.

trans-unit.source: Hence, there is a smooth transition from content-based recommendations to recommendations based on collaborative filtering.
trans-unit.target: Hence, there is a smooth transition from content-based recommendations to recommendations based on collaborative filtering.

trans-unit.source: Even if user or item features are not available, Matchbox will still work in its collaborative filtering mode.
trans-unit.target: Even if user or item features are not available, Matchbox will still work in its collaborative filtering mode.

trans-unit.source: More details on the Matchbox recommender and its underlying probabilistic algorithm can be found in the relevant research paper: <externalLink><linkText>Matchbox: Large Scale Bayesian Recommendations</linkText><linkUri>http://research.microsoft.com/pubs/79460/www09.pdf</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: More details on the Matchbox recommender and its underlying probabilistic algorithm can be found in the relevant research paper: <externalLink><linkText>Matchbox: Large Scale Bayesian Recommendations</linkText><linkUri>http://research.microsoft.com/pubs/79460/www09.pdf</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: In addition, the <externalLink><linkText>Machine Learning Blog</linkText><linkUri>http://blogs.technet.com/b/machinelearning/</linkUri></externalLink> has a post titled <externalLink><linkText>Recommendations Everywhere</linkText><linkUri>http://blogs.technet.com/b/machinelearning/archive/2014/07/09/recommendations-everywhere.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>, which provides a high-level introduction.
trans-unit.target: In addition, the <externalLink><linkText>Machine Learning Blog</linkText><linkUri>http://blogs.technet.com/b/machinelearning/</linkUri></externalLink> has a post titled <externalLink><linkText>Recommendations Everywhere</linkText><linkUri>http://blogs.technet.com/b/machinelearning/archive/2014/07/09/recommendations-everywhere.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>, which provides a high-level introduction.

trans-unit.source: Examples
trans-unit.target: Examples

trans-unit.source: For examples of how to create scores from a recommendation engine, see this sample in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For examples of how to create scores from a recommendation engine, see this sample in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The sample provides a detailed walkthrough of how to configure the different types of input, and how to use the results of different recommendation models for model evaluation.
trans-unit.target: The sample provides a detailed walkthrough of how to configure the different types of input, and how to use the results of different recommendation models for model evaluation.

trans-unit.source: The sample also contains tips for how to implement a recommendation engine in production using a web service.
trans-unit.target: The sample also contains tips for how to implement a recommendation engine in production using a web service.

trans-unit.source: Movie Recommender
trans-unit.target: Movie Recommender

trans-unit.source: How to Configure Score Matchbox Recommender
trans-unit.target: How to Configure Score Matchbox Recommender

trans-unit.source: This module has two required inputs and two optional inputs:
trans-unit.target: This module has two required inputs and two optional inputs:

trans-unit.source: Required inputs
trans-unit.target: Required inputs

trans-unit.source: <ui><token>P_Score.learner</token></ui>.
trans-unit.target: <ui><token>P_Score.learner</token></ui>.

trans-unit.source: A trained recommendation model, which you can create by using <link xlink:href="fa4aa69d-2f1c-4ba4-ad5f-90ea3a515b4c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train</link>.
trans-unit.target: A trained recommendation model, which you can create by using <link xlink:href="fa4aa69d-2f1c-4ba4-ad5f-90ea3a515b4c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train</link>.

trans-unit.source: <ui><token>P_Score.datasetToScore</token></ui>.
trans-unit.target: <ui><token>P_Score.datasetToScore</token></ui>.

trans-unit.source: Data for which you wish to make predictions.
trans-unit.target: Data for which you wish to make predictions.

trans-unit.source: The columns required in the input dataset depend on both the kind of prediction you want to create, and the selected entity.
trans-unit.target: The columns required in the input dataset depend on both the kind of prediction you want to create, and the selected entity.

trans-unit.source: For example, a single row of input might represent a user, an item, or a user-item pair.
trans-unit.target: For example, a single row of input might represent a user, an item, or a user-item pair.

trans-unit.source: See the following section for details on the how to prepare your input data for scoring.
trans-unit.target: See the following section for details on the how to prepare your input data for scoring.

trans-unit.source: Optional inputs
trans-unit.target: Optional inputs

trans-unit.source: <ui><token>P_Score.userFeatures</token></ui>.
trans-unit.target: <ui><token>P_Score.userFeatures</token></ui>.

trans-unit.source: An optional dataset containing user features.
trans-unit.target: An optional dataset containing user features.

trans-unit.source: The dataset of user features must contain the identifiers of users in its first column.
trans-unit.target: The dataset of user features must contain the identifiers of users in its first column.

trans-unit.source: The remaining columns contain the features characterizing the users.
trans-unit.target: The remaining columns contain the features characterizing the users.

trans-unit.source: In prediction, only the features of users who have not rated any items (<newTerm>cold-start users</newTerm>) need to be supplied.
trans-unit.target: In prediction, only the features of users who have not rated any items (<newTerm>cold-start users</newTerm>) need to be supplied.

trans-unit.source: Features of users who have rated items will be ignored by <ui>Score Matchbox Recommender</ui> as they have already been learned during training.
trans-unit.target: Features of users who have rated items will be ignored by <ui>Score Matchbox Recommender</ui> as they have already been learned during training.

trans-unit.source: If the Matchbox recommender has been trained without using user features, do not use user features when scoring.
trans-unit.target: If the Matchbox recommender has been trained without using user features, do not use user features when scoring.

trans-unit.source: <ui><token>P_Score.itemFeatures</token></ui>.
trans-unit.target: <ui><token>P_Score.itemFeatures</token></ui>.

trans-unit.source: An optional dataset containing item features.
trans-unit.target: An optional dataset containing item features.

trans-unit.source: This dataset must contain item identifiers in its first column.
trans-unit.target: This dataset must contain item identifiers in its first column.

trans-unit.source: The remaining columns contain features that characterize the items.
trans-unit.target: The remaining columns contain features that characterize the items.

trans-unit.source: In prediction, only the features of items which have not been rated by any users (<newTerm>cold-start items</newTerm>) need to be supplied.
trans-unit.target: In prediction, only the features of items which have not been rated by any users (<newTerm>cold-start items</newTerm>) need to be supplied.

trans-unit.source: Features of rated items will be ignored by <ui>Score Matchbox Recommender</ui> as they have already been learned during training.
trans-unit.target: Features of rated items will be ignored by <ui>Score Matchbox Recommender</ui> as they have already been learned during training.

trans-unit.source: If the Matchbox recommender has been trained without using item features, do not use item features when scoring.
trans-unit.target: If the Matchbox recommender has been trained without using item features, do not use item features when scoring.

trans-unit.source: Note that missing values of a user or item feature will automatically be replaced with the mode of its non-missing training set values.
trans-unit.target: Note that missing values of a user or item feature will automatically be replaced with the mode of its non-missing training set values.

trans-unit.source: In addition, all user and item features will be rescaled by the corresponding maximum absolute values seen in training.
trans-unit.target: In addition, all user and item features will be rescaled by the corresponding maximum absolute values seen in training.

trans-unit.source: No translation is applied to the feature values, so as to maintain their sparsity.
trans-unit.target: No translation is applied to the feature values, so as to maintain their sparsity.

trans-unit.source: String-valued features are converted into a set of binary-valued indicator features.
trans-unit.target: String-valued features are converted into a set of binary-valued indicator features.

trans-unit.source: Rating Prediction
trans-unit.target: Rating Prediction

trans-unit.source: To use <ui>Score Matchbox Recommender</ui> to predict ratings for given user-item pairs, and optionally their respective features, set <ui><token>P_Score.predictionKind</token></ui> to <ui><token>T_RecommenderPredictionKind.RatingPrediction</token></ui>.
trans-unit.target: To use <ui>Score Matchbox Recommender</ui> to predict ratings for given user-item pairs, and optionally their respective features, set <ui><token>P_Score.predictionKind</token></ui> to <ui><token>T_RecommenderPredictionKind.RatingPrediction</token></ui>.

trans-unit.source: No further parameters are required.
trans-unit.target: No further parameters are required.

trans-unit.source: When you set the value of <token>P_Score.predictionKind</token> to <token>T_RecommenderPredictionKind.RatingPrediction</token>, the following conditions apply:
trans-unit.target: When you set the value of <token>P_Score.predictionKind</token> to <token>T_RecommenderPredictionKind.RatingPrediction</token>, the following conditions apply:

trans-unit.source: The second input to the module, which is the dataset to score, must consist of <legacyBold>user-item pairs</legacyBold>
trans-unit.target: The second input to the module, which is the dataset to score, must consist of <legacyBold>user-item pairs</legacyBold>

trans-unit.source: User identifiers are expected in the first column of the associated dataset, and the corresponding item identifiers are expected in the second column.
trans-unit.target: User identifiers are expected in the first column of the associated dataset, and the corresponding item identifiers are expected in the second column.

trans-unit.source: The dataset to score can also contain a third column of user-item ratings.
trans-unit.target: The dataset to score can also contain a third column of user-item ratings.

trans-unit.source: This third column will be ignored during prediction.
trans-unit.target: This third column will be ignored during prediction.

trans-unit.source: The output dataset contains user-item-rating triples – in other words, a set of rating predictions for each input user and item.
trans-unit.target: The output dataset contains user-item-rating triples – in other words, a set of rating predictions for each input user and item.

trans-unit.source: The output of <ui>Score Matchbox Recommender</ui> is a dataset of user-item-rating triples.
trans-unit.target: The output of <ui>Score Matchbox Recommender</ui> is a dataset of user-item-rating triples.

trans-unit.source: That is, the module returns one predicted rating for each user-item pair that was provided in the input dataset.
trans-unit.target: That is, the module returns one predicted rating for each user-item pair that was provided in the input dataset.

trans-unit.source: Item Recommendation
trans-unit.target: Item Recommendation

trans-unit.source: To use <ui>Score Matchbox Recommender</ui> to recommend items for a given list of users, set <ui><token>P_Score.predictionKind</token></ui> to <ui><token>T_RecommenderPredictionKind.ItemRecommendation</token></ui>.
trans-unit.target: To use <ui>Score Matchbox Recommender</ui> to recommend items for a given list of users, set <ui><token>P_Score.predictionKind</token></ui> to <ui><token>T_RecommenderPredictionKind.ItemRecommendation</token></ui>.

trans-unit.source: When using item recommendation, you can further choose between a production and an evaluation mode.
trans-unit.target: When using item recommendation, you can further choose between a production and an evaluation mode.

trans-unit.source: In <newTerm>production mode</newTerm>, the module makes recommendations from all items seen during training.
trans-unit.target: In <newTerm>production mode</newTerm>, the module makes recommendations from all items seen during training.

trans-unit.source: In <newTerm>evaluation mode</newTerm>, the module makes recommendations only from those items in the test set (dataset to score) which have been rated.
trans-unit.target: In <newTerm>evaluation mode</newTerm>, the module makes recommendations only from those items in the test set (dataset to score) which have been rated.

trans-unit.source: To choose <legacyBold>production mode</legacyBold>, which is the typical scenario for a web service, set <ui>Recommended Item Selection</ui> to <ui><token>T_RecommenderItemSelection.FromAllItems</token></ui>.
trans-unit.target: To choose <legacyBold>production mode</legacyBold>, which is the typical scenario for a web service, set <ui>Recommended Item Selection</ui> to <ui><token>T_RecommenderItemSelection.FromAllItems</token></ui>.

trans-unit.source: To choose <legacyBold>evaluation mode</legacyBold>, which is typically used during experimentation, set <ui>Recommended Item Selection</ui> to <ui><token>T_RecommenderItemSelection.FromRatedItems</token></ui>.
trans-unit.target: To choose <legacyBold>evaluation mode</legacyBold>, which is typically used during experimentation, set <ui>Recommended Item Selection</ui> to <ui><token>T_RecommenderItemSelection.FromRatedItems</token></ui>.

trans-unit.source: If you set <ui>Recommended Item Selection</ui> to <ui><token>T_RecommenderItemSelection.FromAllItems</token></ui>, the scored dataset returned by the module cannot be evaluated using the <link xlink:href="e9ad68a7-e91b-4ae6-800e-b5ee7e22cd17" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Evaluate</link> module.
trans-unit.target: If you set <ui>Recommended Item Selection</ui> to <ui><token>T_RecommenderItemSelection.FromAllItems</token></ui>, the scored dataset returned by the module cannot be evaluated using the <link xlink:href="e9ad68a7-e91b-4ae6-800e-b5ee7e22cd17" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Evaluate</link> module.

trans-unit.source: You can set the number of items you want to recommend to a user.
trans-unit.target: You can set the number of items you want to recommend to a user.

trans-unit.source: By default, 5 items will be recommended.
trans-unit.target: By default, 5 items will be recommended.

trans-unit.source: The second module input, dataset to score, must consist of users to make recommendations to.
trans-unit.target: The second module input, dataset to score, must consist of users to make recommendations to.

trans-unit.source: User identifiers are expected in the first and only column.
trans-unit.target: User identifiers are expected in the first and only column.

trans-unit.source: That is, there must not be more than one column in the dataset to score.
trans-unit.target: That is, there must not be more than one column in the dataset to score.

trans-unit.source: You can use the <link xlink:href="1ec722fa-b623-4e26-a44e-a50c6d726223" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Project Columns</link> module to select the user column from a larger dataset, if needed.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <link xlink:href="1ec722fa-b623-4e26-a44e-a50c6d726223" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Project Columns</link> module to select the user column from a larger dataset, if needed.

trans-unit.source: The scored dataset returned by <ui>Score Matchbox Recommender</ui> lists the recommended items for each user.
trans-unit.target: The scored dataset returned by <ui>Score Matchbox Recommender</ui> lists the recommended items for each user.

trans-unit.source: The first column contains the user identifiers and all subsequent columns (up to <ui><token>P_Score.maxRecommendedItemCount</token></ui>) contain the corresponding recommended item identifiers, ordered by user-item affinity (the item with highest affinity first).
trans-unit.target: The first column contains the user identifiers and all subsequent columns (up to <ui><token>P_Score.maxRecommendedItemCount</token></ui>) contain the corresponding recommended item identifiers, ordered by user-item affinity (the item with highest affinity first).

trans-unit.source: You can set the number of items you want to recommend to a user.
trans-unit.target: You can set the number of items you want to recommend to a user.

trans-unit.source: By default, 5 items will be recommended.
trans-unit.target: By default, 5 items will be recommended.

trans-unit.source: You can also set the minimum number of items that must be recommended for a single user.
trans-unit.target: You can also set the minimum number of items that must be recommended for a single user.

trans-unit.source: By default, this parameter is set to 2.
trans-unit.target: By default, this parameter is set to 2.

trans-unit.source: If you choose <ui><token>T_RecommenderItemSelection.FromRatedItems</token></ui>, the input dataset consist of <legacyBold>user-item pairs</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: If you choose <ui><token>T_RecommenderItemSelection.FromRatedItems</token></ui>, the input dataset consist of <legacyBold>user-item pairs</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: User identifiers are expected in the first column of the corresponding dataset.
trans-unit.target: User identifiers are expected in the first column of the corresponding dataset.

trans-unit.source: The corresponding item identifiers are expected in the second column.
trans-unit.target: The corresponding item identifiers are expected in the second column.

trans-unit.source: The dataset to score can contain a third column of user-item ratings which will be ignored.
trans-unit.target: The dataset to score can contain a third column of user-item ratings which will be ignored.

trans-unit.source: The scored dataset returned by <ui>Score Matchbox Recommender</ui> lists the recommended items for each user.
trans-unit.target: The scored dataset returned by <ui>Score Matchbox Recommender</ui> lists the recommended items for each user.

trans-unit.source: The first column contains the user identifiers and all subsequent columns (up to <token>P_Score.maxRecommendedItemCount</token>) contain the corresponding recommended item identifiers, ordered by user-item affinity (the item with highest affinity first).
trans-unit.target: The first column contains the user identifiers and all subsequent columns (up to <token>P_Score.maxRecommendedItemCount</token>) contain the corresponding recommended item identifiers, ordered by user-item affinity (the item with highest affinity first).

trans-unit.source: Related Users
trans-unit.target: Related Users

trans-unit.source: To use <ui>Score Matchbox Recommender</ui> to find users related to a specific user, set <ui><token>P_Score.predictionKind</token></ui> to <ui><token>T_RecommenderPredictionKind.RelatedUsers</token></ui>.
trans-unit.target: To use <ui>Score Matchbox Recommender</ui> to find users related to a specific user, set <ui><token>P_Score.predictionKind</token></ui> to <ui><token>T_RecommenderPredictionKind.RelatedUsers</token></ui>.

trans-unit.source: When predicting related users, you can choose between <newTerm>production mode</newTerm> and <newTerm>evaluation mode</newTerm>.
trans-unit.target: When predicting related users, you can choose between <newTerm>production mode</newTerm> and <newTerm>evaluation mode</newTerm>.

trans-unit.source: In <legacyBold>production mode</legacyBold>, the module bases its recommendation only on users seen during training.
trans-unit.target: In <legacyBold>production mode</legacyBold>, the module bases its recommendation only on users seen during training.

trans-unit.source: In <legacyBold>evaluation mode</legacyBold>, the model bases its recommendations on the users in the test set (dataset to score) who have rated some common items.
trans-unit.target: In <legacyBold>evaluation mode</legacyBold>, the model bases its recommendations on the users in the test set (dataset to score) who have rated some common items.

trans-unit.source: To use <legacyBold>production mode</legacyBold>, which the typical scenario for a web service, set <token>T_RecommenderPredictionKind.RelatedUsers</token> to <token>T_RecommenderUserSelection.FromAllUsers</token>.
trans-unit.target: To use <legacyBold>production mode</legacyBold>, which the typical scenario for a web service, set <token>T_RecommenderPredictionKind.RelatedUsers</token> to <token>T_RecommenderUserSelection.FromAllUsers</token>.

trans-unit.source: To use <legacyBold>evaluation mode</legacyBold>, which is typically used during experimentation, set <token>T_RecommenderPredictionKind.RelatedUsers</token> to <token>T_RecommenderUserSelection.FromUsersThatRatedItems</token>.
trans-unit.target: To use <legacyBold>evaluation mode</legacyBold>, which is typically used during experimentation, set <token>T_RecommenderPredictionKind.RelatedUsers</token> to <token>T_RecommenderUserSelection.FromUsersThatRatedItems</token>.

trans-unit.source: When you set <token>T_RecommenderPredictionKind.RelatedUsers</token> to <token>T_RecommenderUserSelection.FromAllUsers</token>, the scored dataset returned by the <ui>Score Matchbox Recommender</ui> module cannot be evaluated using the <link xlink:href="e9ad68a7-e91b-4ae6-800e-b5ee7e22cd17" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Evaluate</link> module.
trans-unit.target: When you set <token>T_RecommenderPredictionKind.RelatedUsers</token> to <token>T_RecommenderUserSelection.FromAllUsers</token>, the scored dataset returned by the <ui>Score Matchbox Recommender</ui> module cannot be evaluated using the <link xlink:href="e9ad68a7-e91b-4ae6-800e-b5ee7e22cd17" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Evaluate</link> module.

trans-unit.source: You can set the maximum number of related users you want to find for a user.
trans-unit.target: You can set the maximum number of related users you want to find for a user.

trans-unit.source: By default, at most 5 related users will be returned.
trans-unit.target: By default, at most 5 related users will be returned.

trans-unit.source: The second module input, dataset to score, must consist of <legacyBold>users</legacyBold> for which you wish to find related users.
trans-unit.target: The second module input, dataset to score, must consist of <legacyBold>users</legacyBold> for which you wish to find related users.

trans-unit.source: The identifiers of these users are expected in the first and only column.
trans-unit.target: The identifiers of these users are expected in the first and only column.

trans-unit.source: That is, there must not be more than one column in the dataset to score.
trans-unit.target: That is, there must not be more than one column in the dataset to score.

trans-unit.source: You can use the <link xlink:href="1ec722fa-b623-4e26-a44e-a50c6d726223" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Project Columns</link> module to select the user column from a larger dataset, if needed.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <link xlink:href="1ec722fa-b623-4e26-a44e-a50c6d726223" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Project Columns</link> module to select the user column from a larger dataset, if needed.

trans-unit.source: The scored dataset returned by <ui>Score Matchbox Recommender</ui> lists the related users for each user specified in the dataset to score.
trans-unit.target: The scored dataset returned by <ui>Score Matchbox Recommender</ui> lists the related users for each user specified in the dataset to score.

trans-unit.source: The first column contains the identifiers of the users of interest and all subsequent columns (up to <token>P_Score.maxUserCount</token>) contain the identifiers of the corresponding related users, ordered by how related a user is to the user of interest (most related user first).
trans-unit.target: The first column contains the identifiers of the users of interest and all subsequent columns (up to <token>P_Score.maxUserCount</token>) contain the identifiers of the corresponding related users, ordered by how related a user is to the user of interest (most related user first).

trans-unit.source: In evaluation mode, this module can be configured by 3 parameters.
trans-unit.target: In evaluation mode, this module can be configured by 3 parameters.

trans-unit.source: Set the maximum number of related users you want to find for a user.
trans-unit.target: Set the maximum number of related users you want to find for a user.

trans-unit.source: By default, at most 5 related users will be returned.
trans-unit.target: By default, at most 5 related users will be returned.

trans-unit.source: Specify the minimum number of items that both the user of interest and a potentially related user must have rated.
trans-unit.target: Specify the minimum number of items that both the user of interest and a potentially related user must have rated.

trans-unit.source: By default, there need to be at least 2 rated items that the users have in common.
trans-unit.target: By default, there need to be at least 2 rated items that the users have in common.

trans-unit.source: Set the minimum number of related users per user of interest, which defaults to 2.
trans-unit.target: Set the minimum number of related users per user of interest, which defaults to 2.

trans-unit.source: When using the <token>T_RecommenderUserSelection.FromUsersThatRatedItems</token> option, the second input, dataset to score, must consist of <legacyBold>user-item pairs</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: When using the <token>T_RecommenderUserSelection.FromUsersThatRatedItems</token> option, the second input, dataset to score, must consist of <legacyBold>user-item pairs</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: Identifiers of users of interest are expected in the first column of the dataset, and item identifiers are expected in the second column.
trans-unit.target: Identifiers of users of interest are expected in the first column of the dataset, and item identifiers are expected in the second column.

trans-unit.source: The dataset to score can also contain a third column of user-item ratings, which will be ignored.
trans-unit.target: The dataset to score can also contain a third column of user-item ratings, which will be ignored.

trans-unit.source: The scored dataset returned by <ui>Score Matchbox Recommender</ui> lists the related users for each user specified in the dataset to score, if the user meets the conditions in the parameter settings.
trans-unit.target: The scored dataset returned by <ui>Score Matchbox Recommender</ui> lists the related users for each user specified in the dataset to score, if the user meets the conditions in the parameter settings.

trans-unit.source: The first column contains the identifiers of all users of interest and all subsequent columns (up to <token>P_Score.maxUserCount</token>) contain the identifiers of the corresponding related users, ordered by how related a user is to the user of interest (most related user first).
trans-unit.target: The first column contains the identifiers of all users of interest and all subsequent columns (up to <token>P_Score.maxUserCount</token>) contain the identifiers of the corresponding related users, ordered by how related a user is to the user of interest (most related user first).

trans-unit.source: Related Items
trans-unit.target: Related Items

trans-unit.source: To use <ui>Score Matchbox Recommender</ui> to find items related to a specific user, set <token>P_Score.predictionKind</token>to <token>T_RecommenderPredictionKind.RelatedItems</token>.
trans-unit.target: To use <ui>Score Matchbox Recommender</ui> to find items related to a specific user, set <token>P_Score.predictionKind</token>to <token>T_RecommenderPredictionKind.RelatedItems</token>.

trans-unit.source: To use <legacyBold>production mode</legacyBold>, which is the typical scenario for a web service, set<token>T_RecommenderPredictionKind.RelatedItems</token> to <token>T_RecommenderItemSelection.FromAllItems</token>.
trans-unit.target: To use <legacyBold>production mode</legacyBold>, which is the typical scenario for a web service, set<token>T_RecommenderPredictionKind.RelatedItems</token> to <token>T_RecommenderItemSelection.FromAllItems</token>.

trans-unit.source: To use <legacyBold>evaluation mode</legacyBold>, which is typically used during experimentation, set <token>T_RecommenderPredictionKind.RelatedItems</token> to <token>T_RecommenderItemSelection.FromRatedItems</token>.
trans-unit.target: To use <legacyBold>evaluation mode</legacyBold>, which is typically used during experimentation, set <token>T_RecommenderPredictionKind.RelatedItems</token> to <token>T_RecommenderItemSelection.FromRatedItems</token>.

trans-unit.source: If you set <token>T_RecommenderPredictionKind.RelatedItems</token> to <token>T_RecommenderItemSelection.FromAllItems</token>, you cannot use the <link xlink:href="e9ad68a7-e91b-4ae6-800e-b5ee7e22cd17" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Evaluate</link> module to evaluate the scored dataset returned by <ui>Score Matchbox Recommender</ui>.
trans-unit.target: If you set <token>T_RecommenderPredictionKind.RelatedItems</token> to <token>T_RecommenderItemSelection.FromAllItems</token>, you cannot use the <link xlink:href="e9ad68a7-e91b-4ae6-800e-b5ee7e22cd17" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Evaluate</link> module to evaluate the scored dataset returned by <ui>Score Matchbox Recommender</ui>.

trans-unit.source: You can set the maximum number of related items that you want to find for an item of interest.
trans-unit.target: You can set the maximum number of related items that you want to find for an item of interest.

trans-unit.source: By default, at most 5 related items will be returned.
trans-unit.target: By default, at most 5 related items will be returned.

trans-unit.source: The second module input, dataset to score, must consist of <legacyBold>items</legacyBold> for which you wish to find related items.
trans-unit.target: The second module input, dataset to score, must consist of <legacyBold>items</legacyBold> for which you wish to find related items.

trans-unit.source: The identifiers of these items are expected in the first and only column.
trans-unit.target: The identifiers of these items are expected in the first and only column.

trans-unit.source: That is, there must not be more than one column in the dataset to score.
trans-unit.target: That is, there must not be more than one column in the dataset to score.

trans-unit.source: You can use the <link xlink:href="1ec722fa-b623-4e26-a44e-a50c6d726223" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Project Columns</link> module to select the item column from a larger dataset, if needed.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <link xlink:href="1ec722fa-b623-4e26-a44e-a50c6d726223" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Project Columns</link> module to select the item column from a larger dataset, if needed.

trans-unit.source: The scored dataset returned by <ui>Score Matchbox Recommender</ui> lists the related items for each item specified in the dataset to score.
trans-unit.target: The scored dataset returned by <ui>Score Matchbox Recommender</ui> lists the related items for each item specified in the dataset to score.

trans-unit.source: The first column contains the identifiers of the items of interest and all subsequent columns (up to <token>P_Score.maxItemCount</token>) contain the identifiers of the corresponding related items, ordered by how related an item is to the item of interest (most related item first).
trans-unit.target: The first column contains the identifiers of the items of interest and all subsequent columns (up to <token>P_Score.maxItemCount</token>) contain the identifiers of the corresponding related items, ordered by how related an item is to the item of interest (most related item first).

trans-unit.source: In evaluation mode, this module can be configured by 3 parameters.
trans-unit.target: In evaluation mode, this module can be configured by 3 parameters.

trans-unit.source: Set the maximum number of related items you want to find for an item.
trans-unit.target: Set the maximum number of related items you want to find for an item.

trans-unit.source: By default, at most 5 related items will be returned.
trans-unit.target: By default, at most 5 related items will be returned.

trans-unit.source: Specify the minimum number of users that both the item of interest and a potentially related item must have rated.
trans-unit.target: Specify the minimum number of users that both the item of interest and a potentially related item must have rated.

trans-unit.source: By default, there need to be at least 2 users who have rated items in common.
trans-unit.target: By default, there need to be at least 2 users who have rated items in common.

trans-unit.source: Third, you can set the minimum number of related items for each item of interest.
trans-unit.target: Third, you can set the minimum number of related items for each item of interest.

trans-unit.source: This parameter defaults to 2.
trans-unit.target: This parameter defaults to 2.

trans-unit.source: When you use the <token>T_RecommenderItemSelection.FromRatedItems</token> option, the second input, the dataset to score, must consist of <legacyBold>user-item pairs</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: When you use the <token>T_RecommenderItemSelection.FromRatedItems</token> option, the second input, the dataset to score, must consist of <legacyBold>user-item pairs</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: Identifiers of users are expected in the first column of the dataset, and item identifiers are expected in the second column.
trans-unit.target: Identifiers of users are expected in the first column of the dataset, and item identifiers are expected in the second column.

trans-unit.source: The dataset to score can also contain a third column of user-item ratings, which will be ignored.
trans-unit.target: The dataset to score can also contain a third column of user-item ratings, which will be ignored.

trans-unit.source: The scored dataset returned by <ui>Score Matchbox Recommender</ui> lists the related items for each item specified in the dataset to score that meets the chosen parameter settings.
trans-unit.target: The scored dataset returned by <ui>Score Matchbox Recommender</ui> lists the related items for each item specified in the dataset to score that meets the chosen parameter settings.

trans-unit.source: The first column contains the identifiers of all items of interest and all subsequent columns (up to <token>P_Score.maxItemCount</token>) contain the identifiers of the corresponding related items, ordered by how related an item is to the item of interest (most related item first).
trans-unit.target: The first column contains the identifiers of all items of interest and all subsequent columns (up to <token>P_Score.maxItemCount</token>) contain the identifiers of the corresponding related items, ordered by how related an item is to the item of interest (most related item first).

trans-unit.source: Technical Notes
trans-unit.target: Technical Notes

trans-unit.source: This section contains answers to some common questions about using the recommender to crate predictions.
trans-unit.target: This section contains answers to some common questions about using the recommender to crate predictions.

trans-unit.source: How to Use Score Matchbox Recommender with New Users
trans-unit.target: How to Use Score Matchbox Recommender with New Users

trans-unit.source: Typically, to create recommendations, the <ui>Score Matchbox Recommender</ui> module requires the same inputs that you used when training the model, including a user ID.
trans-unit.target: Typically, to create recommendations, the <ui>Score Matchbox Recommender</ui> module requires the same inputs that you used when training the model, including a user ID.

trans-unit.source: That is because the algorithm needs to know if it has learned something about this user during training.
trans-unit.target: That is because the algorithm needs to know if it has learned something about this user during training.

trans-unit.source: But in the case of new users, you might not have a user ID, only some user features such as age, gender, and so forth.
trans-unit.target: But in the case of new users, you might not have a user ID, only some user features such as age, gender, and so forth.

trans-unit.source: You can still create recommendations for users who are new to your system, by handling them as <newTerm>cold-start users</newTerm>.
trans-unit.target: You can still create recommendations for users who are new to your system, by handling them as <newTerm>cold-start users</newTerm>.

trans-unit.source: For such users, the recommendation algorithm does not use past history or previous ratings, only user features.
trans-unit.target: For such users, the recommendation algorithm does not use past history or previous ratings, only user features.

trans-unit.source: For purposes of prediction, a cold-start user is defined as user with an ID that has not been used for training.
trans-unit.target: For purposes of prediction, a cold-start user is defined as user with an ID that has not been used for training.

trans-unit.source: To ensure that IDs do not match IDs used in training, you might create random IDs within a specified range, or allocate a series of IDs in advance for cold-start users.
trans-unit.target: To ensure that IDs do not match IDs used in training, you might create random IDs within a specified range, or allocate a series of IDs in advance for cold-start users.

trans-unit.source: However, if you do not have any collaborative filtering data, such as a vector of user features, you are better of using a classification or regression learner.
trans-unit.target: However, if you do not have any collaborative filtering data, such as a vector of user features, you are better of using a classification or regression learner.

trans-unit.source: How to Use the Matchbox Recommender in Production
trans-unit.target: How to Use the Matchbox Recommender in Production

trans-unit.source: If you have experimented with the Matchbox recommender and then move the model to production, you should be aware of these key differences when using the recommender in evaluation mode and in production mode.
trans-unit.target: If you have experimented with the Matchbox recommender and then move the model to production, you should be aware of these key differences when using the recommender in evaluation mode and in production mode.

trans-unit.source: Evaluation, by definition, requires predictions that can be verified against the <newTerm>ground truth</newTerm> in a test set.
trans-unit.target: Evaluation, by definition, requires predictions that can be verified against the <newTerm>ground truth</newTerm> in a test set.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, when you evaluate the recommender, it must predict only items that have been rated in the test set.
trans-unit.target: Therefore, when you evaluate the recommender, it must predict only items that have been rated in the test set.

trans-unit.source: This necessarily restricts the possible values that are predicted.
trans-unit.target: This necessarily restricts the possible values that are predicted.

trans-unit.source: However, when you operationalize the model, you typically change the prediction mode to make recommendations based on all possible items, in order to get the best predictions.
trans-unit.target: However, when you operationalize the model, you typically change the prediction mode to make recommendations based on all possible items, in order to get the best predictions.

trans-unit.source: For many of these predictions, there will be no corresponding ground truth, so the accuracy of the recommendation cannot be verified in the same way as during experimentation.
trans-unit.target: For many of these predictions, there will be no corresponding ground truth, so the accuracy of the recommendation cannot be verified in the same way as during experimentation.

trans-unit.source: If you do not provide a user ID in production, and provide only a feature vector, you might get as response a list of all recommendations for all possible users.
trans-unit.target: If you do not provide a user ID in production, and provide only a feature vector, you might get as response a list of all recommendations for all possible users.

trans-unit.source: Be sure to provide a user ID.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to provide a user ID.

trans-unit.source: To limit the number of recommendations that are returned, you can also specify the maximum number of items returned per user.
trans-unit.target: To limit the number of recommendations that are returned, you can also specify the maximum number of items returned per user.

trans-unit.source: It is not possible to generate predictions only for items that have not previously been rated.
trans-unit.target: It is not possible to generate predictions only for items that have not previously been rated.

trans-unit.source: This is by design.
trans-unit.target: This is by design.

trans-unit.source: The reason is that, in order to recommend only the items that have not been rated, the recommender would need to store the entire training data set with the model, which would be computationally expensive and increase your use of storage.
trans-unit.target: The reason is that, in order to recommend only the items that have not been rated, the recommender would need to store the entire training data set with the model, which would be computationally expensive and increase your use of storage.

trans-unit.source: If you want to recommend only items that have not been seen by your user, you can request more items to recommend, and then manually filter out the rated ones.
trans-unit.target: If you want to recommend only items that have not been seen by your user, you can request more items to recommend, and then manually filter out the rated ones.

trans-unit.source: If you have access to the training data you should be able to obtain the tuples needed for filtering by making an additional call into the recommender service.
trans-unit.target: If you have access to the training data you should be able to obtain the tuples needed for filtering by making an additional call into the recommender service.

trans-unit.source: Exception

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if number of selected columns in input dataset does not equal to the expected number.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if number of selected columns in input dataset does not equal to the expected number.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if multiple feature vectors were provided for a given user or item.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if multiple feature vectors were provided for a given user or item.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if passed to module learner has invalid type.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if passed to module learner has invalid type.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if no features were provided for a given user or item.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if no features were provided for a given user or item.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs in the case when there are no user features or items for Matchbox recommendations.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs in the case when there are no user features or items for Matchbox recommendations.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if one or more of inputs are null or empty.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if one or more of inputs are null or empty.
